column4: what happens if I cat file1 and file1 is written to while it's in the middle of running the cat command

Is cat guaranteed to give me the file at the end of *some* file write i.e. that the file will end with a newline or is it possible that cat will give me the last line in the middle of its writing i.e. the last line is only half written
Ok, so if I'm dealing with a file that's being constantly written to, I should use cp first and then gzip the cp'd file  instead of using cat file | gzip
you should use fifo/pipes i belive....
